page.title: 14CLUBS AND ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: Horncastle has over 100 different clubs which cater for all ages and for many different activities. Some, like the Theatre Club, Silver Bands and Dancing School provide regular entertainment for the town which no longer has a theatre or cinema. Two examples are as follows: The Pigeon Fanciers' Club. This meets on Fridays and Saturdays in a shed near the Crown Inn. There are fifteen members who race and breed pigeons. We spoke to one person who owns 40 pigeons but some members have many more. The Julie Deane School of Dancing. Founded in 1975, the school now has over 100 members between the ages of 4 and 23. Pupils wear blue or black leotards and tights.All types of dance are taught and many examinations taken.
